intro: Lithocarpus yersinii, commonly known as Yersin's stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a broadleaf evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Vietnam and Cambodia. The plant is characterized by its hard, thick bark and persistent, leathery leaves that remain throughout the year. Its fruit is a hard, one-seeded nut enclosed in a cupule, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
